item.title: Large pothole near drain, 13th February
item.description:

item.title: It’s time to stop messing around and to resurface the whole width of the road from lamp column 3 to LC8 or preferably LC9, making sure to include the bellmouth of Parabola Road., 13th February
item.description:
Outside Ladies' College. So far, the council has followed its usual practice of mend-a-bit, leave-a-bit, mend-a-bit, leave-a-bit, mend-a-bit, all on the line where I would like to cycle. GCC did a very good job of repairing part of the junction with Parabola Road, which was in a terrible state. Then they repainted the white lines. Then they marked much of the road for repair, with the markings carefully avoiding the white lines, including the zigzags of the pelican crossing. Now the white markings have worn off. What's needed, please, is to resurface the whole width of the road from LC3 to LC9. Why can’t GCC repair potholes properly, as other councils do and even as private contractors and utilities do? These potholes have been present for years - all the 7 years I have lived here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayshill Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole on Hatherley Road near the entrance to Windermere Road, 13th February
item.description:
There is a big pothole on the hatherley road opposite the entrance to Windermere Road. It’s on the side of the road leading towards dean close school. Not the side leading to lakeside school. It has majorly damaged my wheel and got a burst tyre after driving over it. It’s resulted in a puncture instantly so had to call out a mobile tyre recovery and paid £170. Not ideal when you have a 4 month old in the car and you’re doing under the speed limit. I’d like this raised as a complaint too as that pothole has been there for some days. And I couldn’t avoid it as would mean driving into the other lane but cars were coming.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 219, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
